summary: The FAA sets and enforces safety rules for all aircraft using the nation’s airspace. The rising popularity of small unmanned aircraft systems—commonly known as drones—has created new enforcement challenges for the agency. FAA safety inspectors view local law enforcement as key resources when investigating potentially unsafe drone use. But, we found some law enforcement agencies don’t know what information to share with FAA or how...
title: Unmanned Aircraft Systems: FAA's Compliance and Enforcement Approach for Drones Could Benefit from Improved Communication and Data
